TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CachedServiceInfoProvider extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.Health.IServiceInfoProvider

Docs.summary: A cached provider for service info retrieved from the HealthVault web-service.
Docs.remarks: This provider will cache the service information it obtains from Platform for a configured or specified period of time.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the provider using the expiration period provided through configuration and retrieving the full service info response.
Docs.remarks: The expiration period is the value of the configuration.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Microsoft.Health.ServiceInfoSections responseSections) cil managed

Docs.param: The categories of information to be populated in the instance, represented as the result of XOR'ing the desired categories.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the provider using the expiration period provided through configuration and retrieving the service information for the specified response sections.
Docs.remarks: The expiration period is the value of the configuration.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.TimeSpan timeToLive) cil managed

Docs.param: Period of time before the cached instance of service info is considered expired, and a new copy is obtained from the HealthVault web-service.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the provider with a specified expiration period and retrieving the full service info response.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Uri healthServiceUrl) cil managed

Docs.param: The URL for the HealthVault web-service to use to retrieve the service information.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the provider using the expiration period provided through configuration and retrieving the full service info response using the specified HealthVault web-service URL.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Microsoft.Health.ServiceInfoSections responseSections, valuetype System.TimeSpan timeToLive) cil managed

Docs.param: The categories of information to be populated in the instance, represented as the result of XOR'ing the desired categories.
Period of time before the cached instance of service info is considered expired, and a new copy is obtained from the HealthVault web-service.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the provider with a specified expiration period and retrieving the service information for the specified response sections.

MemberSignature.Value: public CachedServiceInfoProvider (Microsoft.Health.ServiceInfoSections responseSections, TimeSpan timeToLive, Uri healthServiceUrl);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Microsoft.Health.ServiceInfoSections responseSections, valuetype System.TimeSpan timeToLive, class System.Uri healthServiceUrl) cil managed

Docs.param: The categories of information to be populated in the instance, represented as the result of XOR'ing the desired categories.
Period of time before the cached instance of service info is considered expired, and a new copy is obtained from the HealthVault web-service.
The URL for of the HealthVault web-service to use to retrieve the service information.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the provider with a specified expiration period and retrieving the service information for the specified response sections using the specified HealthVault web-service URL.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Health.ServiceInfo GetServiceInfo() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the service information retrieved from the HealthVault web-service.
Docs.returns: Service information retrieved from the HealthVault web-service.
Docs.remarks: Calls to this method are thread-safe.
